metadata.title: CVE-2018-20669 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An issue where a provided address with access_ok() is not checked wasdiscovered in i915_gem_execbuffer2_ioctl indrivers/gpu/drm/i915/i915_gem_execbuffer.c in the Linux kernel through4.19.13. A local attacker can craft a malicious IOCTL function call tooverwrite arbitrary kernel memory, resulting in a Denial of Service orprivilege escalation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-raspi2 - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-gcp - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-oracle - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1007-oem - 5.6.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1007-raspi - 5.4.0-1007.7
No subscription required
